sect1.title: Machine-independent PCMCIA drivers
sect1.para: The following devices (driver name in parentheses) are supported by machine-independent PCMCIA drivers. If you do not see your device listed here, check your platform's page; there may not yet be a machine-independent driver for your device.

Alternatively, it may be the case that your device is compatible with one listed here, or your device may not be listed due to an oversight. If you are unsure, please send mail to netbsd-help@NetBSD.org.
Please note that these pages reflect the state of NetBSD-current. To check the supported hardware list for a specific release of NetBSD, check that release's installation notes.

itemizedlist.listitem:
Multi-function cards
Megahertz XJEM3336 Ethernet/Modem cards (&man.mhzc.4;, &man.com.4;, and &man.sm.4;).

SCSI host adapters
Adaptec AIC-6260- and AIC-6360-based cards, including the Adaptec APA-1460 (&man.aic.4;).
NCR 53C9x, Emulex ESP406, and Qlogic FAS408 (&man.esp.4;).

Network interfaces
Aironet 4500/4800 and Cisco 340 series wireless network (&man.an.4;) BayStack 650 IEEE 802.11FH wireless network card (&man.awi.4;) Netwave AirSurfer wireless network card (&man.cnw.4;) 3Com 3c562, 3c574 and 3c589 family (&man.ep.4;) Fujitsu MB86960-based cards, including the TDK CD021BX (&man.mbe.4;) NE2000 compatibles (&man.ne.4;) Raytheon Raylink / WebGear Aviator IEEE 802.11 2Mbps Wireless (&man.ray.4;) SMC91c9x-based cards, including Megahertz X-Jack (&man.sm.4;) AT&T/Lucent WaveLan wireless PCMCIA card (&man.wi.4;) Intersil PRISM WaveLan wireless PCMCIA card (&man.wi.4;) Xircom CreditCard PCMCIA Ethernet (&man.xi.4;) IBM and 3Com Tropic-based Token Ring cards (&man.tr.4;)

Serial ports
16550 and compatible UARTs and modem cards, including combination modem/Ethernet cards (&man.com.4;)
Multi-port serial cards, such as the Socket Communications, Inc. Dual Serial interface (&man.pcmcom.4; with &man.com.4; children)

Disk and CD-ROM controllers
MFM, ESDI, IDE, and RLL hard disk controllers, including the Digital Mobile Media CD-ROM (&man.wdc.4;) (supported ATA devices), (supported ATAPI devices).
